org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.annotation

Annotation Type JsonSchemaConfig


  • @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @ContextApply(value=JsonSchemaConfigAnnotation.Apply.class)
public @interface JsonSchemaConfig
    Annotation for specifying config properties defined in JsonSchemaGenerator.

    Used primarily for specifying bean configuration properties on REST classes and methods.

    • Overview > juneau-marshall > JSON-Schema Support
    • Source

    • Element Detail

      • rank

        public abstract int rank
        Optional rank for this config.

        Can be used to override default ordering and application of config annotations.

        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        0

      • addDescriptionsTo

        public abstract String addDescriptionsTo
        Add descriptions to types.

        Identifies which categories of types that descriptions should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The description is the result of calling ClassMeta.getFullName().

        • The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:
          • "BEAN"
          • "COLLECTION"
          • "ARRAY"
          • "MAP"
          • "STRING"
          • "NUMBER"
          • "BOOLEAN"
          • "ANY"
          • "OTHER"
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.addDescriptionsTo(TypeCategory...)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • addExamplesTo

        public abstract String addExamplesTo
        Add examples.

        Identifies which categories of types that examples should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The examples come from calling ClassMeta.getExample(BeanSession,JsonParserSession) which in turn gets examples from the following:

        • Example
        • Marshalled(example)
        • The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:
          • "BEAN"
          • "COLLECTION"
          • "ARRAY"
          • "MAP"
          • "STRING"
          • "NUMBER"
          • "BOOLEAN"
          • "ANY"
          • "OTHER"
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.addDescriptionsTo(TypeCategory...)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • allowNestedDescriptions

        public abstract String allowNestedDescriptions
        Allow nested descriptions.

        Identifies whether nested descriptions are allowed in schema definitions.

        • "true"
        • "false" (default)
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.allowNestedDescriptions()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • allowNestedExamples

        public abstract String allowNestedExamples
        Allow nested examples.

        Identifies whether nested examples are allowed in schema definitions.

        • "true"
        • "false" (default)
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.allowNestedExamples()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • beanDefMapper

        public abstract Class<? extends BeanDefMapper> beanDefMapper
        Bean schema definition mapper.

        Interface to use for converting Bean classes to definition IDs and URIs.

        Used primarily for defining common definition sections for beans in Swagger JSON.

        • This setting is ignored if JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.useBeanDefs() is not enabled.
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.beanDefMapper(Class)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.BeanDefMapper.Void.class

      • ignoreTypes

        public abstract String ignoreTypes
        Ignore types from schema definitions.

        Defines class name patterns that should be ignored when generating schema definitions in the generated Swagger documentation.

        • Format: Comma-delimited list of patterns
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.ignoreTypes(String...)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • useBeanDefs

        public abstract String useBeanDefs
        Use bean definitions.

        When enabled, schemas on beans will be serialized as the following:

        { type: 'object', '$ref': '#/definitions/TypeId' }

        The definitions can then be retrieved from the session using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.getBeanDefs().

        Definitions can also be added programmatically using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.addBeanDef(String, JsonMap).

        • "true"
        • "false" (default)
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder.useBeanDefs()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • detectRecursions

        public abstract String detectRecursions
        Automatically detect POJO recursions.

        Specifies that recursions should be checked for during traversal.

        Recursions can occur when traversing models that aren't true trees but rather contain loops.
        In general, unchecked recursions cause stack-overflow-errors.
        These show up as ParseExceptions with the message "Depth too deep. Stack overflow occurred.".

        The behavior when recursions are detected depends on the value for BeanTraverseContext.Builder.ignoreRecursions().

        For example, if a model contains the links A->B->C->A, then the JSON generated will look like the following when BEANTRAVERSE_ignoreRecursions is true...

        {A:{B:{C:null}}}

        • "true"
        • "false" (default)
        • Checking for recursion can cause a small performance penalty.
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.Builder.detectRecursions()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreRecursions

        public abstract String ignoreRecursions
        Ignore recursion errors.

        Used in conjunction with BeanTraverseContext.Builder.detectRecursions().
        Setting is ignored if BEANTRAVERSE_detectRecursions is "false".

        If "true", when we encounter the same object when traversing a tree, we set the value to null.
        Otherwise, a BeanRecursionException is thrown with the message "Recursion occurred, stack=...".

        • "true"
        • "false" (default)
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.Builder.ignoreRecursions()
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • initialDepth

        public abstract String initialDepth
        Initial depth.

        The initial indentation level at the root.
        Useful when constructing document fragments that need to be indented at a certain level.

        • Format: integer
        • Default value: "0"
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.Builder.initialDepth(int)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""

      • maxDepth

        public abstract String maxDepth
        Max traversal depth.

        Abort traversal if specified depth is reached in the POJO tree.
        If this depth is exceeded, an exception is thrown.

        • Format: integer
        • Default value: "100"
        • Supports Overview > juneau-marshall > Simple Variable Language > VarResolver.DEFAULT (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.Builder.maxDepth(int)
        Returns:
        The annotation value.
        Default:
        ""
